rComments: Estes is a good professor and kind of a legend in ecology- it was cool hearing about his research (that may be all you hear about) - and everything will go smoothly if you put in the effort.

Estes expects his students to respect him and try their best. His exams can be fairly specific, but you will do fine if you go to class, pay attention, do the homework, and review the material in a timely fashion. He's a prolific researcher and really knows his stuff, so ask him if you've got a question. He'll help you out.

This class is rough, keep in mind that it's an broad ecology class for those who have taken introductory ones before. There is a lot of content but none of it is too difficult to understand. Only complaint is that the homework is oddly worded at times but I really do love this class. Estes is renowned for his research and that's super cool.

TA's basically run the course, who need to get off their high horse. No help with practice midterms, homework, poor organization of field trips. Lectures aren't much help. Just a bad class all around. Be prepared for professor Google or to read the textbook start to finish for any understanding.

He's an awesome professor, but an incredibly boring lecturer. To get a good grade you have to be willing to put in the work and actually attend class and listen. Everything in his slides are fair game for the exam, which is all fill-in. Overall, not a hard class, and he wants you to succeed! I gt a B+ by mainly studying the night before. Do better.

Professor Estes give hard midterm + final exams. They were very unexpected. However, he was a very nice and helpful! He doesn't fail his upper div students unless you're not trying! So, that's very considerate of him! I really enjoyed taking his course! I love his sea otter example in every lecture! :)

Prof Estes, was very nice and passionate towards the subject and to the students, he is really caring and a very understanding professor, however his teaching style didnt work for many in the course, the topic itself is so broad, which is mainly memorizing concepts rather than understanding it, he doesnt give much practice problems which is a minus

I usually LOVE ecology. I can ace almost any practice exam when it comes to multiple choice questions regarding terms and examples. I hated this class though. Estes teaches from a mathematical model point of view and gives too many equations that its hard to keep track. If you have the opportunity to take this class with another professor, DO IT
